meanings.definition: To make a transition from one thing to another smoothly and without interruption.
meanings.sent1: She segued from talking about her favorite book to discussing her upcoming vacation.
meanings.sent2: The music segued seamlessly from one song to the next.
meanings.sent3: The magician segued from pulling a rabbit out of a hat to making a coin disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts segued like a flowing river, moving effortlessly from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset segued into the darkness of night, creating a beautiful transition.

meanings.definition: To move smoothly and unhesitatingly from one state, condition, situation, or element to another.
meanings.sent1: He segued from being a student to becoming a teacher without any difficulties.
meanings.sent2: The athlete segued from running to swimming in the triathlon.
meanings.sent3: The cat segued from napping in the sun to chasing a butterfly in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The clouds segued across the sky, changing shapes like a moving painting.
meanings.sent5: The plot of the movie segued unexpectedly, keeping the audience engaged in the story.
